tool.name: CRISPR Recognition Tool
tool.command:
temp_output=\$(mktemp); java -cp \$CRISPR_RECOGNITION_TOOL_JAR_PATH/CRT1.2-CLI.jar crt -minNR $minNR -minRL $minRL -maxRL $maxRL -minSL $minSL -maxSL $maxSL #if str($searchWL) != 'none': -searchWL $searchWL #end if $input \$temp_output ;
python $__tool_directory__/reformat.py \$temp_output $output_region $output

param.name: minNR
param.label: Minimum number of repeats a CRISPER must have

param.name: minRL
param.label: Minimum length of a CRISPER repeated region

param.name: maxRL
param.label: Maximum length of a CRISPER repeated region

param.name: minSL
param.label: Minimum length of CRISPER non repeated region

param.name: maxSL
param.label: Maximum length of CRISPER non repeated region

param.name: searchWL
param.label: Length of search window to used to discover CRISPERs

tool.help:
**What it does**
`CRISPR Recognition Tool <http://www.room220.com/crt/>`_ is a tool for automatic detection of clustered regularly interspaced palindromic repeats (CRISPR). It rapidly and accurately identifies CRISPRs in large DNA strings, such as genomes and metagenomes.
**Input**
DNA sequence in FASTA format
